intro: Seseli hallii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada seseli, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. It is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in open habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
